The event will take place at Evergreen’s Harvard Avenue facility from 11:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. along with an Oregon Health & Science University mobile unit. Many local health partners will be present...
articles.title: EVERGREEN HOLDING CANCER CONVERSATION EVENT AM MAY 5 KB

articles.author: Kyle Bailey
articles.description: May 5, 2025 2:50 a.m. The Fly-in Pig BBQ Competition returns to Myrtle Creek and organizers say it will be bigger, bolder and tastier than ever. The second annual event will take place on Saturday, May 17th from 10:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and Sunday, May 18th from 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. at the...
articles.title: FLY-IN PIG BBQ COMPETITION RETURNS TO MYRTLE CREEK THIS MONTH

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: WINSTON — On Monday and Tuesday, people with disabilities and their families flocked to the Wildlife Safari for a free day of fun as the park opened its doors for the 44th annual Day of Discovery.
articles.title: Day of Discovery; people and families with disabilities hosted at Wildlife Safari

articles.author: Scott Carroll The News-Review
articles.description: SUTHERLIN — A lawsuit filed against the Sutherlin School District on behalf of a young girl, who claimed she was injured when school officials put an ointment inside of her, has been settled for $25,000, substantially less than the nearly…
articles.title: Settlement reached in school lawsuit

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: On Saturday, canines big and small took to the grounds of Stewart Park with their owners during Barks and Recreation, a festival by Saving Grace Humane Society dedicated to all things dog.
articles.title: Dog Lovers flock to Douglas County for Barks and Recreation

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: On Saturday, horticulture enthusiasts came out in droves to the Douglas County Fairgrounds to purchase gardening goods at the Douglas County Master Gardener Association's (DCMGA) Plant and Garden Expo.
articles.title: Plant and Garden Expo brings good times and green thumbs to Roseburg

articles.author: GLORIA COLEMAN The News-Review
articles.description: Cole Stark made asian meatloaf with cilantro lime rice and cilantro lime crema reach the national level.
articles.title: Cole Stark reaches national heights with meatloaf

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Rite Aid is closing all remaining stores nationwide as part of its bankruptcy wind-down. Once operating over 4,500 locations, the chain is shutting down its final stores by mid-2025, with liquidation sales and prescription transfers underway across multiple states.
articles.title: Rite Aid To Close All Stores - What happens to the Roseburg Store?
